sentences.en: All together there are six new faces in the cabinet.
sentences.cn: 内阁现在共有6张新面孔。

sentences.en: By about six, they're cranking the music up loud again.
sentences.cn: 到6点左右，他们又把音乐声音开大了。

sentences.en: He had a staff of six salespeople working for him.
sentences.cn: 他手下有6名销售人员为他工作。

sentences.en: He learnt to play the violin when he was six (= six years old ) .
He was six feet four, all lanky and leggy.
sentences.cn: 他身高6英尺4英寸，瘦高个儿，大长腿。

sentences.en: It would take three to six hours for a round trip.
sentences.cn: 往返行程需要3到6个小时。

sentences.en: More than six million youngsters tune in to Blockbusters every day.
sentences.cn: 每天有600多万年轻人收看“热门大片”这档节目。

sentences.en: She arrived just after six (= six o’clock ) .
She was only six and still missing her front teeth.
sentences.cn: 她才6岁，门牙还没长出来。

sentences.en: Splitting the price six ways had still cost them each a bundle.
sentences.cn: 即使把价钱平摊成6份，每人也还是要花一大笔钱。

sentences.en: The authorities say six civilians have been killed in two separate attacks.
sentences.cn: 当局声称在两次不相关的袭击中已有6名平民丧生。

sentences.en: The batteries had a life span of six hours.
sentences.cn: 这些电池的寿命为6小时。

sentences.en: The election was held six months ahead of schedule.
The six-person jury deliberated about two hours before returning with the verdict.
sentences.cn: 6人陪审团认真商议了约两个小时后作出了裁定。

sentences.en: They identified six plants as having potential for development into pharmaceutical drugs.
sentences.cn: 他们验明6种植物有可能提炼出药物麻醉剂。

sentences.en: They walked through the dense Mozambican bush for thirty six hours.
sentences.cn: 他们花了36个小时穿过茂密的莫桑比克丛林。

sentences.en: Up to twenty thousand students paid between five and six thousand dollars.

words.tran_cn: （与 the 连用）第六的，第六个的；六分之一的
月的第六日，（与the连用的）第六个；六分之一

phrases.tran_cn: 乱七八糟：混乱或杂乱的状态
大六教学法，大六法；指美国六大会计事务所
(英，非正式)惊吓某人；彻底击败某人

phrases.phrase: six of one and half a dozen of the other
